newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine October car output may rise 10 percent.
newsitem.headline: Argentine October car output may rise 10 percent.

text.p: Argentine car output may rise about 10 percent in October from September mainly due to a strong production increase in Ford Motor Co's local unit, according to data from the main automakers.
Ford Argentina expects to produce 5,650 vehicles in October, more than double the 2,695 of September, a source from the company said.
The sharp increase is due to the fact that, in October, Ford stepped on the gas to produce its new Escort to replace the Orion, which is being discontinued, the source added.
Italy's FIAT local unit FIAT Auto Argentina SA plans to raise its output in October to between 5,200-5,300 from 4,273 in September, a company source said.

Both the local subsidiary of Volkswagen, which ranked first in September output, and CIADEA, licensee of Renault, which ranked second, plan to stick to their previous output -- about 8,000 for Volkswagen and 6,000 for CIADEA, sources at the two firms said.
Likewise, production at Sevel, wich makes Peugeots under license, could stay about the same as in September, when it made 4,664 vehicles, analysts said.
The subsidiary of General Motors expects to make some 1,830 vehicles in October, up from 1,724 in September.

Argentina produced 28,092 vehicles in September, with the five largest companies accounting for more than 90 percent of the total. The country's producers association ADEFA is expected to announce October's car output next week.
